title: Callbacks
subject: JavaScript
theory:
A callback is a function passed as an argument to another function.
This technique allows a function to call another function.
A callback function can run after another function has finished.

examples.explanation: `display` is passed (without parens!) and called inside `calculator`.

interview_questions.question: What is Callback Hell?
interview_questions.answer: Nested callbacks (pyramid of doom) creating unreadable and unmaintainable code. Solved by Promises.

practice_problems.problem: Use `setTimeout` to run a function after 3 seconds.

real_world_use_cases.description: `button.addEventListener('click', callback)` is the most common use.

exam_notes: Callbacks are the foundation of Async JS.
Inversion of Control is a risk with 3rd party callbacks.
summary: Do X. When you are done, call Y. That is a callback.
